lines.text: I was FROZEN today!
Do you have any idea what we are gonna do to you, if we find one itty, bitty scratch on 'em?
Let me guess. You're gonna pound my face. Break every bone in my body. Then you're gonna drag me across a gravel road and feed my remains to a warthog. Is that about right?
What are you nuts? This is the '90s. We're gonna sue you.

[in a kids voice]
You're a dead man, Ramsey.
No wonder you guys don't talk.
They're here.
Who's here?
A couple of leeches that make their living of the blood of others.
Investment bankers?
Bounty hunters!
Bounty hunters? You mean from up there?
Anti-freeze!
I'm here to rent the apartment.

Look, I'm your landlord. I bring you an extra bar of soap when you need it. Perhaps I can help stop the occasional bank robbery. But being the target of intergalactic bounty hunters is a little out of my line!
Strike out?
I didn't even get up to bat.
Earthlings... I *hate* earthlings...
What am I gonna do for six weeks?
Why don't you try... relaxing?
[shep makes a face]
Disappear, Shep. Blend in. Get to know the locals.
But I...

[interrupting firmly]
consider it an order... Ramsey.

[commander's face disappears; to himself]
Six weeks. What am I gonna do for six weeks...?
[Shep catches a little girl who went airborne when he tried to get her cat out of a tree]
Whoa! Thanks.
Get a goldfish.

[awoken by the sounds of people chattering all over]
Quiet!
[chattering stops, with the exception of a cricket chirping]

[to the cricket]
Hey!
[chirping stops]
Where's my N-210 Algorizer?

[points a gun at Shep]
All right, drop him, Kong.
It's OK, Margie, this is a friend of mine.
Well, then, take it outside. You know, maintenance has enough work to do without your blood on the carpet.

[sees little girl crying]
What?

[crying]
My cat. My cat!
[Shep sees a cat in the nearby tree, bends branch downward]
That's not my cat!
Oh.
[releases branch, sending the cat flying]
I hate suburbia.

[Meeting with Japanese Businessmen]
Look who's here! Welcome! Konichiwa! Konichiwa! Just trying to rival that celebrated Japanese sense of employee relations you people are born with or so it seems.

[speaking Japanese]
I think I'm gonna hate this guy.

[Beltz doesn't speak Japanese and Kim translates]
Uh, Mr. Zukaki says he is very impressed with your knowledge of his culture.

[to Kim in Japanese]
Coward.

[Beltz is showing the Japanese businessmen around an unfinished part of the building where he awards are being displayed]
By the way, do you like it in here? It's finished. I'm kidding, I'm kidding, but this is the way his building is going to look. These are all jokes. Anyway, take a look. Seriously, over here fellas. See that space? That's how confident I am about this project, I'm unveiling it at the signing.

[in Japanese]
Boy, when this guy shovels it, he uses both hands.

[after Charlie nearly gets run over by the punks in the Camaro]
Weak strategy Wilcox! Should've opened the door wider, always deal from strength!
They would've ripped the door off Colonel!
